name: 45 / 7 inch Card Record Sleeves (50 Pack)
description:
Lightweight white card sleeves (50 pack) are perfect for the protection of 45s or 7 inch records.

Comes with centre hole so the record label is easily read. Paper or plastic inner sleeves will fit inside or can be used without.

Made from 18pt paperboard (350gsm approx)

Replace those worn and torn record company sleeves. Protect your antiques for future generations to enjoy. Protect your investment. Record not included.

Brand New stock

name: Mobile Fidelity Record Brush Replacement Pads (MFSL)
description:
The new Mobile Fidelity LP Brush is here and it's the best brush currently available! We offer a set of two replacement cleaning pads which are simple to put on the brush after you have cleaned about 100-150 records.

Brush pictured available separately, these pads are suitable for this brush (pictured) only.

name: Mobile Fidelity Record Brush (MFSL)
description:
Here's an inexpensive tool for keeping all of your irreplaceable records clean and cared for! We are very proud to offer the latest in essential record care products:

The Mobile Fidelity LP Record Brush! Easy to use, easy to clean, this record brush is guaranteed to keep all of your LPs clean and quiet! It gets really deep into the grooves and helps scrub all that nasty, noisy dirt out.

The key to its great vinyl cleaning is found in Mobile Fidelity's proprietary cleaning pad and ergonomic brush handle. It's been designed for multi-purpose use: it can be used as a wet-cleaning brush (we recommend using it as part of your intensive record cleaning machine workout) or as simply the best dry record brush ever designed. One cleaning pad will clean hundreds of your favorite LPs. For best results, we recommend the use of a simple single step record cleaning fluid.

Is this the best record brush ever designed?

Stock up on a few of these brushes and keep your records in pristine condition! For cleaning:We recommend keeping an unused toothbrush around for cleaning the pads on the Mobile Fidelity LP Brush. Remember...a clean brush is a happy brush...and one that will not transfer debris onto other records!

- Record cleaning brush
- Wideness corresponds to playable area of an LP
- Exchangeable pads

name: Large Turntable Water Level
description:
Large Perspex Water Level with Spindle Hole. Using this tool you can then make adjustments to your turntable accordingly.

If your turntable is not level it will affect the way the stylus sits in the groove. This can cause channel imbalance and possibly uneven wear to both the record and the stylus.

name: 45 / 7 inch Polyethelene Outer Sleeve (100 pack)
description: Pack of 100. Made fom high clarity polyethylene the plastic outer sleeves help protect old cardboard / paper covers from ring wear, dust and other pollutants. Designed specifically for the protection of 45s / 7 inch records.

name: 78 / 10 inch Polyethelene Inner Sleeve (100 pack)
description: 78 / 10 inch Polyethelene Inner Sleeve (100 pack) resists static build up and is less abrasive than paper.

name: 45 / 7 inch Poly-lined Paper Sleeve (100 pack)
description:
Polylined Paper Inner Sleeve Premium 45 / 7 inch Sleeves. Packet of 100

These sleeves give that added protection against dust and particles with archival polypropylene lining. The polypropolene resists static build up and protects against abrasion.

name: LP / 12 inch Picture Disc PVC Sleeve (10 pack)
description: Picture Disc Sleeve (10 pack) are made from crystal clear, 8 gauge PVC. Made for the specific purpose of LP Picture Discs. Have a flap to seal the LP from dust and other pollutants.

name: LP / 12 inch "Oversize" Polyethelene Sleeve (50 Pack) 180g
description:
Pack of 50. Made fom high clarity "Oversize" 3mil polyethylene the plastic outer sleeves help protect old cardboard covers. 330mm x 330mm. 

Perfect for 180g LPs, Double LPs even some triple LPs! Item pictured is a Double Gatefold 180g LP with a thick jacket.

name: 45 / 7 inch Mailer (25 pack) VICTORIA
description:
7 inch / 45 Record Cardboard Mailers (pack of 25). Made from Corrugated Cardboard. Send up to 5 7 inch single records. 192mm x 192mm x 15mm (when folded).

Safely and professionally send your 45s / 7 inch single or EPs anywhere around the globe in these sturdy mailers. 

Brand New stock

Goods sent via post or Express Post as requested, I will happily combine postage.

Because of the size of these packs postage varies on location. As a consequence please select the correct state / area prior to your purchase. If your state is not selectable please email info@sweetlittlehifi.com.au

name: LP / 12 inch Thick Polyethelene Outer Sleeves (100 pack)
description: Made from thick 4mil Polyethelene and in a Pack of 100. 12''/ LP Thick Outer Record Sleeve. Fits directly over record sleeve. These sleeves offer protection to LP artwork, ring wear, dust, dirt, finger oils and other pollutants. These sleeves have passed a Photo Activity Test (P.A.T.) certifying that they are safe for long-term storage. Protect your antiques for future generations to enjoy. Protect your investment.

name: 45 Adapter Plastic Dome "Red"
description: This red plastic "dome shaped" 45 Adapter is a must for anyone who collects 7 inch singles / 45s. They always seem to go missing when you need one! For use with those 7-inch records that have the large hole thats found on many US 45s or Jukebox 7-inch records.Also have them in Blue or even Aluminium!

name: 45 Adapter (Snap In Type) (50 pack)
description: These 45 Adapters (50 Pack) snap into those 7-inch records that have the large hole thats found on many US 45s or Jukebox 7-inch records. Large quantities available to order please contact!

name: Ortofon OM3E MM Cartridge & Stylus
description:
Ortofon OM 3E Moving Magnet Cartridge and Stylus. Elliptical.Perefect entry level Cartridge for your musical pleasure. Comes with mounting instructions and mounting screws.

Genuine Ortofon Cartridge and Stylus, Can be fitted to any turntable with a 1/2 inch mount.

    Frequency range 20-20.000 Hz
    Frequency response 20-18.000 Hz + 2 / - 3 dB
    Tracking ability at 315Hz at recommended tracking force *)      60   µm Compliance, dynamic, lateral 20 µm/mN

    Equivalent stylus tip mass 0,5 mg
    Tracking force range 1,5-2,0 g (15-20 mN)
    Tracking force, recommended 1,75 g (17,5 mN)
    Tracking angle 20°
    Stylus colour Black
    Recommended for following cartridges OM 3E, OMP 3E

Genuine Ortofon Cartridge and Stylus, Can be fitted to any turntable with a 1/2 inch mount.

name: Ortofon OM 78 MM Cartridge & Stylus
description:
The OM 78 is a magnetic cartridge (MM) with a 65µm spherical stylus that is perfect for playback of 78rpm records, which require a larger stylus profile for proper playback. Comes with mounting instructions and mounting screws.

Genuine Ortofon Cartridge and Stylus, Can be fitted to any turntable with a 1/2 inch mount.

Wires for connecting Cartridges / Styluses to a Headshell. 

Will fit most (if not all) cartridges and headshells. Brands such as Technics, Ortofon, Numark, Sansui, Hitachi to name a few.

Will fit most turntables and cartridges. Brands such as Technics, Ortofon, Numark, Sansui, Hitachi to name a few, if in doubt please ask.

name: Medium Tone Gramophone/ Phonograph Needles (100 pack)
description:
Brand New Gramophone/ Phonograph Needles! Pack of 100 Medium Tone Stainless Steel Needles. Made in Europe. 

Gramophones do not have a volume control knob! The way to control volume is to choose, Loud, Medium or Soft Tone Needles.

Will suit most old gramophones, Recommended for single use only.

name: Soft Tone Gramophone/ Phonograph Needles (100 pack)
description:
Brand New Gramophone/ Phonograph Needles! Pack of 100 Soft Tone Stainless Steel Needles. Made in Europe. 

Gramophones do not have a volume control knob! The way to control volume is to choose, Loud, Medium or Soft Tone Needles.

Will suit most old gramophones, Recommended for single use only.

name: Loud Tone Gramophone/ Phonograph Needles (100 pack)
description:
Brand New Gramophone/ Phonograph Needles! Pack of 100 Loud Tone Stainless Steel Needles. Made in Europe. 

Gramophones do not have a volume control knob! The way to control volume is to choose, Loud, Medium or Soft Tone Needles.

Will suit most old gramophones, Recommended for single use only.

name: Antistatic Turntable Mat
description:
Give your turntable a spruce up with a new mat. 

When you play your records static electricity is often created. This charge causes cracking and static noise. At the same time the record attracts dust. 

By using an antistatic mat it will discharge static while playing. The mat consists of felt mixed with vey fine carbon fibres. It is easier to brush dust off a discharged record. Diameter 297mm or 11 3/4 inches.

name: PRO.2 Inline Phono Pre-Amplifier
description:
Unlike line level audio sources you connect to a stereo (DVD/CD players, tape decks, TV audio, minidisc, etc.), the output from a magnetic cartridge installed in a good quality turntable is MUCH lower, and requires an additional stage of amplification to bring it up to the same volume as the other sources you listen to thru your stereo. This additional amp stage, the phono preamp, is built-in to most older receivers and amps, allowing direct connection of a turntable. However, newer stereo equipment (including virtually all mini-systems and home theatre units, as well as many stereo receivers and amps), have NO phono input (this because records and turntables are supposedly obsolete in today’s world dominated by CDs and DVDs!).

In order to utilise the inputs such units DO have (Aux, Tape, Line, Video, CD, etc.) to connect a turntable, you need to first pass the signal thru an external phono preamp to bump the level. The same level increase is needed if you’re connecting a turntable to a computer sound card’s line input so you can make CD-Rs from LPs; again, the external phono preamp provides it.

Features:
* Ultra compact design
* Use either 9v Battery or 9v-100maH Power supply (if you want the power supply please order the Pre-Amp with Optional Power Supply!)
* Simply plug and play
* Dimensions: 86 x 28 x 60mm (WHD)

name: PRO.2 Inline Phono Pre-Amp with Optional Power Supply
description:
Unlike line level audio sources you connect to a stereo (DVD/CD players, tape decks, TV audio, minidisc, etc.), the output from a magnetic cartridge installed in a good quality turntable is MUCH lower, and requires an additional stage of amplification to bring it up to the same volume as the other sources you listen to thru your stereo. This additional amp stage, the phono preamp, is built-in to most older receivers and amps, allowing direct connection of a turntable. However, newer stereo equipment (including virtually all mini-systems and home theatre units, as well as many stereo receivers and amps), have NO phono input (this because records and turntables are supposedly obsolete in today’s world dominated by CDs and DVDs!).

In order to utilise the inputs such units DO have (Aux, Tape, Line, Video, CD, etc.) to connect a turntable, you need to first pass the signal thru an external phono preamp to bump the level. The same level increase is needed if you’re connecting a turntable to a computer sound card’s line input so you can make CD-Rs from LPs; again, the external phono preamp provides it.

Features:
* Ultra compact design
* Use either 9v Battery or 9v-100maH Power supply (not supplied but are available for $15.00, please ask!)
* Simply plug and play
* Dimensions: 86 x 28 x 60mm (WHD)

name: Ortofon Turntable Water Level
description: Genuine Ortofon Turntable Water Level. Used to ensure your Turntable is level, this will improve playback of your vinyl records.

name: The Ultimate Analogue Test LP
description:
Analogue Productions set out to produce the ultimate test record: We’ve consulted many experts in the field, including mastering engineers, audio experts, turntable experts and audiophile listeners, to create a test record that's never been made before. When Barry Wolifson from Sterling Sound in New York City called us with the same idea we had been thinking about – that being to create the ultimate test record – he and our audio expert Clark Williams began to brainstorm and research ideas until they were both completely satisfied with what should go on the record.

Most of the test records in the past have been made to test a variety of equipment. This test record excludes silly cannon shots, typewriters, voices on one channel and other useless fluff. This one specifically addresses your turntable and cartridge. It’s designed to provide the basic test signals necessary to calibrate a turntable or cutting lathe as simply as possible. Most of the signals have specific implications, but it is certainly possible to use them in any number of novel ways.

This record was mastered and cut on a Neumann VMS 80 lathe at Sterling Sound and pressed at Record Technology, Inc. on high-quality, 180-gram virgin vinyl.

Features:
• 180g Virgin Vinyl

Selections:
Side 1
General Reference Level
This 1 kHz reference tone will allow you to establish a “base level” for all measurements.
Track 1. 1Khz reference tone 7cm/s lateral in phase (mono)
Basic reference for all measurements, adjust meter for maximum convenience (in the studio 0VU).
Adjust preamp channel balance for equal output.
Also used to check the offset angle of the photo cartridge; L&R signals should be exactly in phase as displayed on an oscilloscope.

Azimuth Adjustment
Track 2. 1kHz reference level, Left channel only
Measure Right channel output.
Track 3. 1kHz reference level, Right channel only
Measure Left channel output.
The object is to sit the stylus exactly perpendicular in the groove.
Twist cartridge about its radial axis until the measurements from Track 2 and Track 3 are equal or very close to equal for both channels.

High Frequency Adjustment
Tracks 4-6 are used to calibrate the RIAA high frequency equalizer of a phono preamp. This will be used to calibrate a mastering lathe’s phono preamplifier or any phono preamplifier that has these adjustments.
Track 4. 1 kHz tone at -20db below reference level, Lateral
Reference for High Frequency test.
Track 5. 10 kHz reference tone at -20db, Lateral
Adjust the high frequency until the output level equals that of Track 4.
Track 6. 1 kHz to 20 kHz sweep at -20db, Lateral
The AC millivolt meter reading should stay constant across all frequencies. There are a number of factors which can affect frequency response, including cable capacitance, cartridge loading, tracking force and worn parts. Because of this, it can be difficult to achieve perfectly flat frequency response. Sometimes by making small compromises in the 10 kHz adjustment, a better overall frequency response can be achieved.

Low Frequency Adjustment
Tracks 7 & 8 are used to calibrate the RIAA low frequency equalizer of a phono preamp.
Track 7. 1 kHz to 20 Hz sweep at 0VU (Lateral)
Play Track 7 and measure the output with your AC millivolt meter.
Ideally, the output will be flat across all frequencies. When viewed on an oscilloscope, the amplitude would remain constant during the frequency downsweep.
Track 8. 100 Hz reference tone at 0VU (Lateral)
Adjust LF Eq to reference (which is your reading from Track 1).

Track 9. VTA adjust
This is an IEC intermodulation distortion (IMD) test signal; 60Hz & 4kHz 4:1 ratio.
Using an IMD tester, adjust VTA by raising or lowering the tonearm for minimum distortion.

Track 10. Standard Wow & Flutter test signal; 3150Hz
The Wow & Flutter meter will give dynamic speed variations as a percentage deviation from nominal.
Also, the frequency counter should read exactly 3150 Hz for nominal speed. You can use the Hz function on your multi-meter (if so equipped) to verify speed here as well. You can also use to find the measurements at 45RPM. The correct reading at 45RPM would be 4253 Hz (45/33.33) x 3150.

Side 2
Track 1. Anti-skating test; 315Hz amplitude sweep to +12db (Lateral)
Signal should remain clean in both channels up to the highest level, both audibly and as viewed on an oscilloscope. In case of distortion, increase anti-skating force or decrease anti-skate until breakup occurs equally in both channels. The left channel information is inscribed on the inner groove wall, the right channel information, on the outer groove wall. Because of the offset angle of a pivoted tonearm, a constantly varying vector force biases the arm towards the center of the record causing the stylus to lose contact with the outer (i.e. right channel) groove wall. Both linear and modulated groove velocity, tracking force, stylus profile, and vinyl composition are contributing factors. The anti skating force attempts to ameliorate this by applying an opposing similar force.
It is also accepted that the overall force vector increases as the tonearm approaches closer to the spindle or end of the record.

Track 2. Pink noise lateral
Track 3. Pink noise vertical
Used for cartridge “demagnetizing”
You can also use this track to loosen up the cantilever’s suspension to help break in a new cartridge. Play these tracks five to ten times after every 300 hours of normal LP playback.

Track 4. 1kHz at reference level, vertical
This out-of-phase signal should cancel to nothing when summed to mono.
Any signals still present are distortion artifacts, lack of channel balance, or timing (phase) anomalies. This test can be a second confirmation of anti-skate adjustment.

Track 5. 1kHz to 10Hz sweep at -20db below
reference level, vertical
Resonance anomalies in the tonearm / cartridge interface will show up as amplitude peaks and dips as the frequency sweeps down.
Once again, by listening in ‘Mono’ it is easier to hear the distortion artifacts.

Track 6. Silent groove for bearing rumble and table isolation
During playback of this track, nothing should be transmitted from the turntable to the speakers. Replay the track and gently tap on the rack or base that the turntable is resting on. There should be little or no thump transferred to the speakers. This track will help you experiment with turntable isolation methods and products to be able to get the most out of your playback system. You may want to use a closed or sealed headphone for best listening results, or a stethoscope on the plinth.

name: MFSL Geo-Disc Phono Cartridge Alignment Tool Geodisc LP
description:
Mounting and aligning phonograph cartridges can be a tedious and time-consuming chore. Not with the Mobile Fidelity Sound Lab (MFSL) GEO-DISC!

This cartridge alignment device is simple to use and extremely accurate. Just fit the disc on your platter and align using the simple printed graph based on the Baerwald alignment curve.

Instructions printed on the Geo-Disc itself. You will never realize the full potential of your cartridge without the proper set-up tool.

name: Disc Stabiliser / Vinyl Record Clamp
description:
This is a Vinyl Record Clamp also known as a Stabiliser. It is the perfect way to improve your record's sound by dampening your LP for increased resolution. It slides over the spindle. It will achieve better contact between the record and the platter mat. It weighs 455g. The diameter at the base is 70mm and it is 24mm high. For use with spindles 21mm or less. Please Note : Not suitable for Thorens Turntables.

Features:

Dampens internal resonance of revord under play and reduces sonic colouration

Designed for both antique 78s and modern LPs and 7 inches

Increases the mass of the rotation system to reduce flutter

Mass couples disc to being played to platter allowing easier play of warped records and preventing slipping.

Reduces stylus and vinyl wear

Improved bass and provide better instrument

Has felt bottom to care for label

name: Paper CD / DVD Sleeves with Window (100 Pk)
description:
Pack of 100. Paper CD / DVD Sleeves with Plastic Window. Protects loose CDs and DVDs from scratches and finger marks. 

We all have loose CDs and DVDs that don't seem to have a home, why not protect them!

description:
Pack of 100. Made fom high clarity polyethylene the plastic outer sleeves help protect Digipak / Cardboard CD covers. These will also fit regular Jewel Cases. Protects them from rubbing and general wear and tear. Designed specifically for the protection of CD Digipak Covers

These sleeves are 156mm x 136mm in size.

description: Made fom high clarity polyethylene the plastic outer sleeves help protect Card CD Sleeves / covers. Protects them from rubbing and ring wear. Designed specifically for the protection of CD Card sleeves. Protect your CD artwork

description:

Designed specifically for the protection of old 78 / 10 inch records. 270mm x 270 mm.

description:
Made from 62.5 micron Polypropolene and in a Pack of 100. These resealable sleeves are clearer and stiffer than usual Polyethelene Sleeves. Similar to cellophane. Have that retail look about them. Fits directly over record jacket. 

These sleeves offer protection to 7 inch artwork, ring wear, dust, dirt, finger oils and other pollutants, great for archiving or looks good for retail.

name: 45 / 7 inch Resealable Polypropolene Record Sleeve (100 pack)
description:
Resealable Pocket Outer Sleeves with Flap for 45s / 7 inch Records (100 pack)

NEW IMPROVED DESIGN! Adhesive now on bag for easier insertion and reusability.

Made from clear polypropolene (similar to cellophane) the plastic outer sleeves help protect old cardboard / paper covers from ring wear. By sealing your record in these pocket sleeves, it provides an impenetrable barrier to dust and other pollutants.

Designed specifically for the protection of 45s / 7 inch records. Protect your antiques for future enjoyment. Protect your investment. Record not included. 

By sealing your record in these pocket sleeves, it provides an impenetrable barrier to dust and other pollutants.

To demonstrate the sizing, the first photo on this listing shows Nirvana's Live At Reading which is a 180g double LP. Fits directly over record jacket.

name: LP / 12 inch Rice Paper Style Premium Inner Sleeve (50 Pack)
description:
"Rice-Paper" Style. HD Polyethelene & Acid-Free Paper Premium LP / 12 inch Sleeves. Packet of 50

These High-Density Polyethylene (HDPE) Sleeves are similiar to the original "Rice-Paper" Sleeves. They are made from 3 layers of HDPE and 1 layer of acid-free paper which is sandwiched between 2 of the layers of HDPE. The acid-free paper neutralizes migrating acids as well as absorbs moisture. The HDPE resists static build up and protects against abrasion.

name: LP / 12 inch Polylined Paper Premium Inner Sleeve (50 pack)

These sleeves give that added protection against dust and particles with archival polypropylene lining. The polypropolene resists static build up and protects against abrasion.

description: Lightweight white paper sleeves (100 pack) are perfect for the protection of 45s or 7 inch records. With die-cut center hole both sides. Acid-free material. Replace those worn and torn record company sleeves.

name: Antistatic Record Cleaning Cloth
description: This antistatic record cloth does more than just clean your records. It removes static, lubricates and protects the vinyl playing surface and prevents dust build up in the grooves. Use the record cloth by iteself or with a record cleaner for an extra thorough cleaning.

name: Ortofon Stylus Brush
description: Genuine Ortofon Stylus Brush. Keep your stylus clean. prolong its working life. Gently brush against stylus from the back of the cartridge to the front. Repeat as necessary.

name: Stylus Cleaner 37.5ml
description: Stylus Cleaner 37.5ml. Keep your stylus clean. prolong its working life. To use add 2 drops of the stylus brush (not included, available from store!) Gently brush against stylus from the back of the cartridge to the front. Repeat as necessary. Rinse brush with warm water and allow to air dry.

name: Alcohol Free 78 Record LP Vinyl Cleaner 238ml
description: Record cleaner is a must for any record collector. 78 Records require special cleaning care. They are not all made from the same material. Shellac, Laminate and Acetate records should be cleaned with an alcohol-free solution. Used with a cloth, 78 records should not be saturated with cleaners or water. nor should they be played or stored wet. Ensures proper every day cleaning at the same time being the most effective cleaning method for badly soiled records.

name: Super Exstatic Carbon Fibre / Velvet Pad Anti-Static Record Brush
description:
The super exstatic record brush is more effective than a standard carbon fibre brush and designed to clean grime and dust out of record grooves prior to playing vinyl LPs. Soft carbon fibre bristles work in conjunction with a soft velvet pad to remove dust at a stroke, leaving the groove clean and prolonging the life of both discs and stylus.

This brush is offers four distinct advantages

    Under its own weight only the carbon fibres touch the record surface discharging static electricity.
    Press Down and the velvet pad picks up all debris
    Electrically conductive assembly discharges static through the conductive ribs on the body
    The central velvet pad protects both the carbon fibres and and record surfaces from inadvertant damage

name: Carbon Fibre Brush Vinyl Record Cleaner
description: The best thing you should use to clean your records prior to playing is a Carbon Fibre Record Brush. Cloths can catch dust and particles then scratch records with the collected dust and particles (cloths are best used with a record cleaner). Used dry a carbon fibre brush with thousands of bristles are fine enough to get right into the record grooves and lift dust and particles out.

name: Velvet Pad Record Cleaner w/ Stylus Brush
description: This velvet pad record cleaner is gentle on your records. Using this pad prior to play will remove dirt and finger prints from the record and protect your precious stylus and of course improves sound!. Comes with a Stylus Brush in the lid.  Can be used wet or dry.

name: Record LP Vinyl Cleaner with Antistatic Cloth 250ml
description:
Record cleaner is a must for any record collector. This specially formulated solution ensures proper every day cleaning at the same time being the most effective cleaning method for badly soiled records. Cloth is stored inside the lid.

How To Use:
Everyday Cleaning:
Wet enclosed cloth with Record Cleaner Solution and apply along the record grooves. The Record Cleaner efficiently removes dust and dirt whilst keeping the record antistatic.

Badly Soiled Records:
Apply Record Cleaner solution to Velvet Pad and thouroughly clean the record. The Velvet Pad removes all dissolved impurities from the record groove. During this process the solution must be completely wiped away, as dissolved impurities will otherwise remain in the groove.

*****Not recommended for Shellac, Laminate or Acetate Records, such as old 78s.*****

name: LP / 12 inch Plastic Inner Sleeve Round Bottom (100 pack)
description: Pack of 100. 12'' Inner Record Sleeve. Fits directly over record. These sleeves offer resistance to static build up and protect against abrasions. Round bottom makes insertion into record jackets easier. 37.5 micron HDPE Film. Protect your antiques for future generations to enjoy. Protect your investment. Record not included.
